address: 1021 S El Camino Real, San Mateo, CA 94402, USA
title: San Mateo County Pride Center
description: The San Mateo County Pride Center is a collaboration model organization and one-stop shop for the LGBTQ+ community. We offer robust programs and services to support LGBTQ+ community members of all ages, including education, training, community events, peer support groups, daily programming, clinical therapy, and case management.

title: Hawaii LGBT Legacy Foundation
description: A non-profit organisation committed to supporting and promoting the LGBTQ+ community in Hawaii. It hosts a variety of projects and events including Honolulu Pride, Rainbow Town Hall and Coming Out Stories. It also provides a range of resources and support services.

title: Understanding and Supporting Transsexuality in Children and Parents
description: This German article offers a comprehensive guide for families dealing with transsexuality in parents or children. It provides information about key procedures and resources, offering guidance from understanding and accepting the situation to pursuing relevant treatments.

title: North Shore Alliance of Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgender Youth (NAGLY)
description: NAGLY's mission is to honor, respect, educate, and empower GLBTQ+ youth. They foster a community through local programs and support services, including youth and adult groups and various community activities. They offer mental health resources, provide healthcare education, and offer many opportunities for the LGBTQ+ community to connect and share their experiences.

title: Queerspace
description: Queerspace is an LGBTIQ+ health and wellbeing support service established in 2009 by LGBTIQ+ communities for LGBTIQ+ communities. It has a focus on relationships, families, parenting and young people and offers co-located services across the north- west metropolitan region of Victoria. Services include counselling, case management, advocacy, support services, peer support, professional development, training and consulting.

title: DIYHRT.cafe
description: A vibrant online community and hub of knowledge for individuals interested in do-it-yourself hormone replacement therapy (HRT). Their website is dedicated to providing a safe and inclusive space where people can access information, resources, and support for self-administered HRT. Whether you are exploring alternative methods, seeking guidance on dosage and administration, or simply looking to connect with others who share similar experiences, DIYHRT.cafe offers a wealth of valuable insights, personal stories, and expert advice to help you make informed decisions about your health and well-being.

title: Stuttgarter Declaration: Gender. Self. Determined.
description: The Stuttgarter Declaration emphasizes the importance of respectful treatment of transgender and intersex people. It underlines the significance of human rights in medical, psychotherapeutic, consulting, and support services for transgender and intersex individuals. Developed by physicians, psychotherapists, human rights activists, and affected individuals, it emphasizes the right to determine one's own gender and the obligation for medical treatments to respect this self-determination.

address: 911 E Pike St #314, Seattle, WA 98122, USA
title: Lavender Rights Project
description: Lavender Rights Project elevates the power, autonomy, and leadership of the Black intersex & gender diverse community through intersectional legal and social services. It provides life-saving policy and social change advocacy, comprehensive care, and legal services to LGBTQ+ individuals, with a particular emphasis on supporting Black trans communities.

title: DEiFYDEiFYQTIBIPOC Collective residing on Ngunnawal, Ngunawal and Ngambri Country
description: This is a collective meeting for the DEiFYQTIBIPOC community. The group will also discuss the Queer Masculinities Zine and their specific playlist.

title: Bundesverband Trans* e.V.
description: Bundesverband Trans* e.V. is a national association that advocates for the rights of trans* persons in Germany, including those identifying as transsexual, transgender, genderqueer, non-binary, and trans*. They aim for the legal, political, and medical reform to improve the conditions for this community by organizing workshops, offering consultation, and releasing publications.

address: 152/168 The Horsley Dr, Carramar NSW 2163, Australia
title: NSW Service for the Treatment and Rehabilitation of Torture and Trauma Survivors
description: STARTTS is a specialist, not-for-profit organisation that provides culturally relevant psychological treatment, support, and community interventions to help people and communities heal from torture and refugee trauma and rebuild their lives in Australia. They also support LGBTQIA+ individuals from refugee and asylum seeker backgrounds.

title: FTMGuide.org
description: A comprehensive online platform dedicated to supporting individuals who are transitioning from female to male (FTM). Their website serves as a trusted resource, offering a wealth of information, guidance, and community connections for those embarking on their FTM journey. From practical advice on hormone therapy and surgical options to mental health support and personal stories, FTMGuide.org aims to empower individuals with the knowledge and resources they need to navigate their transition with confidence and clarity.

title: Black Rainbow
description: Black Rainbow is a national Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander LGBQTIA+SB volunteer social enterprise focused on the health and wellbeing of their community. This strives to extend its services, despite being unfunded, through donations, fee for service and sales of educational materials. They initiate outreach projects, support social events, and gather funds for community enhancement and research on health impacts.

title: Minus18
description: Minus18 is Australia's charity improving the lives of LGBTQIA+ youth. They tackle social isolation by creating spaces where young people belong, are celebrated and can make friends. They also deliver LGBTQIA+ training, resources, and digital campaigns, aiming to create an Australia free from discrimination. Their aim is to equip young people with the skills and opportunities they need to be at the forefront of driving change.

title: Youth Eastside Services
description: Youth Eastside Services (YES) is a non-profit organization that provides comprehensive mental health and substance abuse services to youth and their families, regardless of their ability to pay. Located in Washington, its services cover counseling, therapy, support for LGBTQ+ community, and various community-based programs.

address: 911 E Pike St #221, Seattle, WA 98122, USA
title: Ingersoll Gender Center
description: An organization by and for transgender and gender nonconforming people providing mutual support through peer led support groups, advocating in navigating resources, community organizing, and education — all in the pursuit of our collective self-determination.

title: U.S. Trans Survey
description: The U.S. Trans Survey is the largest survey of trans people, by trans people, in the United States. It documents the lives and experiences of trans and nonbinary people aged 16+ in the U.S. and U.S. territories. The survey and its reports have been a vital resource, including reports on the experiences of people of color and by state, helping to shape the future through trans voices.

title: transfemscience.org
description: A groundbreaking online platform dedicated to providing evidence-based research, education, and resources for the transgender and non-binary community, with a particular focus on feminizing hormone therapy (FHT). Their website serves as a vital hub for individuals seeking reliable and up-to-date information on the medical, physiological, and psychological aspects of FHT. Through their comprehensive collection of peer-reviewed studies, expert articles, and practical guides, their site empowers individuals to make informed decisions about their transition and health.

title: nonbinary.ch - A Resource for Non-binary Individuals
description: A comprehensive Swiss website providing information and resources related to non-binary gender identities. It's meant to help individuals exploring their own gender identity, or those who interact with non-binary individuals, by making foundational knowledge easily accessible. The site also hosts a blog, a newsletter, and links to relevant external resources like books, films, and research.

title: Human Rights Campaign
description: Human Rights Campaign fights for the rights and equality of the LGBTQ+ community. They aim to end discrimination and advance pro-equality policies through education, advocacy, and mobilization. They also provide resources for those in the LGBTQ+ community to get involved in their local areas.

address: 450 Sutter Street, 450 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
title: Gender Confirmation Center
description: The Gender Confirmation Center provides comprehensive gender-affirming care, through multiple types of procedures and treatment plans, for the transgender, nonbinary, and gender diverse community.

title: The Pinnacle Foundation
description: The Pinnacle Foundation is an Australian education charity providing scholarships, mentoring and opportunities to young LGBTQIA+ Australians. The scholarships are awarded for fulltime study at public institutions of higher education in Australia.

title: FTM-Portal.net
description: FTM-Portal.net is the largest German-speaking information platform for transmen and other transmasculinities providing experiences and tips on various living situations. This resource is helpful for any person assigned female at birth who does not fully or partially identify with this initial classification. Relatives of transmen and other interested parties may also register.

title: TGNS Transgender Network Switzerland
description: TGNS is a network for transgender people in Switzerland. They provide legal advocacy, work towards healthcare reforms, and offer mental health resources to the transgender community. They engage in a variety of awareness and education programs aimed at creating a supportive and inclusive environment for individuals identifying as transmasculine, transfeminine, and non-binary. TGNS also has youth services, support groups, and resources for family and partners of transgender individuals.

title: Medicijnkosten - Medication Costs Information
description: An informative platform that provides details about medication costs. It offers data regarding the reimbursement of medications and alternatives available for individuals who may not afford certain medication. Important for financial planning of healthcare.

title: Open Doors Youth Service
description: Supporting LGBTIQAP+ youth and their families in South East Queensland. Providing services like mental health counselling, group therapy programs, social supports, providing essential food & sanitary items, securing stable employment and housing, and conducting training & education with schools, workplaces, and families.

title: Stonewall Medical Centre and Sexual Health Clinic – Brisbane
description: Stonewall Medical Centre has been proudly servicing the general health and sexual health of Brisbane’s lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex and queer / questioning (LGBTQIA+), sex workers and the straight / heterosexual community since 1995. The clinic provides a variety of services including HIV PEP & PrEP, STI testing, consultations for sex workers, medical care for transgender and gender diverse individuals, steroid & image enhancing drug monitoring, and referrals among others.

address: Havelock House, 85 Northbourne Ave, Turner ACT 2612, Australia
title: Meridian
description: Meridian has been advocating for, and supporting, the LGBTIQA+ community for over 40 years, offering a range of services and programs across the Canberra region such as HIV services, wellbeing services, sex worker outreach programs and more.

title: TransPonder
description: TransPonder is a transgender founded and led nonprofit in Eugene, Oregon which provides support, resources, and education for the trans/gender-diverse community and our allies. They offer various resources and events such as gender diverse yoga class, Transponder Book Club, and support groups.

title: Australian Transgender Support Association of Queensland
description: Queensland's peak body representing transgender, gender diverse, and non-binary individuals since 1990. They provide support, advocacy, services and organize social events to serve the transgender community.

title: TopSurgery.net
description: TopSurgery.net is a comprehensive resource for individuals seeking information on FTM top surgery procedures. The resource provides details on various types of surgical procedures, how to find a surgeon, information on costs and insurance, FAQs, and other relevant resources for transmasculine and non-binary individuals pursuing top surgery. It also includes educational content such as book recommendations, video tutorials, and articles on related topics.

title: Jim Collins Foundation
description: The mission of the Jim Collins Foundation (JCF) is to provide financial assistance to transgender people for gender-affirming surgeries. This foundation offers two grant options; The Founders' Grant which covers 100% of the surgical costs and The Krysallis Anne Hembrough Legacy Fund which covers 50% of surgical costs. The foundation aims to provide access to these vital surgeries for those who want it but due to prevalent discrimination against transgender people, such costs are usually impossible to meet.

address: 2525 Camino del Rio S # 107, San Diego, CA 92108, USA
title: Dr. Donna M. Chapman Psychotherapy, San Diego
description: Dr. Chapman's clinic offers Emotionally Focused Therapy, Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR), Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) and other services. Its practice is inclusive and specifically caters to the transgender community, assisting in the transition process and helping families adjust.

address: 21430 Lorain Rd #400, Fairview Park, OH 44126, USA
title: Colors+ Youth Center
description: Colors+ strengthens the LGBTQ+ youth and allies by promoting individual and community wellness. Provides programs for LGBTQ+ youth and allies such as individual, couples, and family counseling services.

title: Transgender India: Your Transition Guide
description: Transgender India provides comprehensive courses, articles and resources for the transgender community in India. It includes topics ranging from hormone replacement therapy basics, legal rights and protections, to social transitions, with courses led by specialists from various fields.

title: Queermed Deutschland Directory
description: Queermed Deutschland is a directory of doctors, therapists and practices recommended by the LGBTQIA+ community, in Germany. The aim is to combat discrimination in the healthcare system, ensuring a respectful and sensitive healthcare for all. It includes various additional options in the anonymous questionnaire to cater to diverse individuals within the community.

title: How To Wear A Packer
description: This article provides guidance on how to wear a packer, including tips on positioning, choosing the right size, how your packer should be placed, and ways to keep your packer in place. It serves as an educational resource for those in the transmasculine and non-binary community who wish to learn more about packing.

address: 46 Woods St, Darwin City NT 0800, Australia
title: Northern Territory AIDS and Hepatitis Council Inc.
description: A community response to Blood Borne Viruses in the Northern Territory, aiming to eliminate their transmission. Offers a range of services such as supporting LGBTI Living, promoting sex worker outreach, and providing health promotion and health clinics.

title: genderdysphoria.fyi
description: A trusted online resource for individuals seeking knowledge, support, and understanding about gender dysphoria. Their website provides a wealth of information, resources, and community connections to empower individuals on their journey. From comprehensive guides on gender identity and transitioning to personal stories and expert advice, they strive to create a safe and inclusive space for all.

address: 307 E Northern Lights Blvd Suite 101, Anchorage, AK 99503, USA
title: Identity Alaska
description: Alaska-based nonprofit community center and health clinic providing resources, programs, and healthcare for the LGBTQIA2S+ and allied community.

title: Unitarian Universalist Association
description: An open-minded, open-hearted spiritual community supporting people in leading lives of justice, love, learning, and hope. The community embraces diversity including the transgender community and encourages active participation in acts of justice. They also offer resources, support and advocacy for various social issues.

title: Personalized Pronoun Dressing Room
description: This interactive resource provides examples of various pronoun sets used in context. It's customizable with any name you'd like, which aids in the exploration and understanding of personal pronouns. This tool is useful to the transgender community, especially to those who are exploring new pronouns or educating others on pronoun use.

title: Movement Advancement Project
description: The Movement Advancement Project (MAP) is an independent, nonprofit think tank that provides rigorous research, insight, and communications that help speed equality and opportunity for all. MAP works to ensure that all people have a fair chance to pursue health and happiness, earn a living, take care of the ones they love, be safe in their communities, and participate in civic life.

title: Jordan Ross Communication Services
description: Jordan Ross provides speech, voice and communication coaching for trans, queer and gender non-conforming individuals. He offers 1-On-1 coaching, online courses, events, and the 'Voice Within Coaching Program'. His approach incorporates neuro-linguistic programming, hypnotherapy, yoga instruction, and breath coaching, aiming to address not just physical but also mental, emotional, and energetic aspects of communication.

address: 7, 10 Anson St, Observatory, Cape Town, 7925, South Africa
county: City of Cape Town Metropolitan Municipality
title: Gender Dynamix Online Education Portal
description: Gender Dynamix is an Africa-based non-profit organization that aims to promote, advance, and protect the human rights of trans and gender diverse communities in South Africa and across southern Africa. The organization conducts advocacy, facilitates capacity building, and provides direct services to the community. They also offer online resources related to healthcare, educational programs, and legal gender recognition.

address: 147 W 24th St #5th, New York, NY 10011, USA
title: Sylvia Rivera Law Project (SRLP)
description: The Sylvia Rivera Law Project works to guarantee that all people are free to self-determine gender identity and expression, regardless of income or race, and without facing harassment, discrimination or violence. SRLP provides legal help, organizes campaigns, conducts trainings, and runs a Prisoner Advisory Committee. Community involvement is encouraged through donations, volunteering, and membership.

title: Trans Sask Resources
description: Trans Sask is a non-profit organization that provides support and acts as a resource network for trans-identified, genderqueer, intersex and gender non-conforming individuals, their spouses, family, friends, and allies. Resources offered include accessing affirming healthcare, name change guide and trans-inclusive media guide.

address: 31 S Commerce Way #100, Bethlehem, PA 18017, USA
title: Allentown Women’s Center
description: A comprehensive healthcare provider that specializes in services catering to a wide array of demographic including the transgender community. Services range from abortion procedures, gynecology care, gender-affirming services, and medical marijuana certification amongst others.

title: Erin In The Morning
description: News and discussion on trans legislation and life. By Erin Reed · Over 38,000 subscribers

title: Trans Health SA
description: Trans Health SA is a volunteer group that exists to provide information and support for the health needs of trans and gender diverse people in South Australia. It provides lists of respectful practitioners, medical and legal information, information about supportive agencies, organizations, publications, social and support groups, and resources created by the transgender community.

title: EqualDex.com
description: An innovative online platform that aims to create a comprehensive and up-to-date resource for global LGBTQ+ rights. Their website provides a centralized database of laws, policies, and societal attitudes towards LGBTQ+ rights from around the world. By mapping and visualizing data on equality, inclusivity, and legal protections, EqualDex.com offers a powerful tool for activists, researchers, and individuals seeking to understand and advocate for LGBTQ+ rights on a global scale. Explore their interactive maps, browse country-specific profiles, and stay informed about the latest advancements and challenges facing the LGBTQ+ community worldwide.

title: How to pack ftm with socks | DIY Packer
description: This blog post offers a comprehensive guide on how to make a homemade packer using socks and other affordable materials. Also includes DIY alternatives for other FTM prosthetics to help transmasculine individuals feel more comfortable and authentic.

title: TransAdvice Peer based transgender support chat. Live Support Chat
description: TransAdvice is a community driven network offering a safe and open space for support and resources for members of the transgender and non-binary communities, as well as their family members, significant others, friends, and allies.

title: The Gender Affirmative Letter Access Project
description: The GALAP is a platform for independent clinicians providing gender affirming care. They offer resources such as therapist directories, letter writing guides for gender affirmation and more. Please note, the skills or expertise of any pledge signer cannot be verified by GALAP.

title: A Gender Agenda
description: A Gender Agenda works with and on behalf of intersex, trans and gender diverse people, their friends, families, and allies. Through education, advocacy, peer support, and professional networks, AGA connects people to each other and builds off the collective experiences. They offer numerous events and resources for the community, including support groups, training, educational resources. They provide advocacy and crisis helpline.

title: strandsfortrans.org
description: Strands For Trans is a global network of hair, beauty, and wellness industries and organizations that seek to create and inspire safe and positive experiences for all guests, especially guests from the trans community.

title: Pacific Center for Human Growth
description: Founded in 1973, Pacific Center for Human Growth is the oldest LGBTQIA+ center in the Bay Area, the third oldest in the nation, and operates the only sliding scale mental health clinic for LGBTQIA+ and QTBIPOC people and their families in Alameda County.

title: Transgender Victoria
description: TGV is Victoria’s leading body for trans and gender diverse people. We work to achieve justice, equity and inclusion for our communities, their partners, families, friends, and allies. We provide various resources, training, advocacy, and support services aimed at the social, economic, health, wellbeing, and mental health outcomes for the transgender community.

title: Margie’s Hope
description: Margie’s Hope was founded in 2011 by Jacob Nash. Our history and purpose has been to enrich the lives of Transgender, Non-Binary, and Gender Expansive people in the community. Margie’s Hope offers resources and support through various community programs and a not for profit resale store.

address: 1515 E 52nd Pl 3rd Floor, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
title: Brave Space Alliance
description: Brave Space Alliance is the first Black-led, trans-led LGBTQ+ Center located on the South Side of Chicago, providing affirming and culturally competent services for the entire LGBTQ+ community of Chicago.

title: Oakland LGBTQ Community Center
description: Oakland's first ever Non-profit 501c3, all ages, all inclusive LGBTQ community service center. Services offered include support groups, mental health support, housing assistance, youth program, legal clinic, food pantry etc. Special programs are also conducted for aged LGBTQ+ people and transgender community members.

title: Gender Census
description: The Gender Census is an annual survey that collects data about the language used by people who do not identify within the gender binary. The survey, which has been conducted annually since 2015, seeks to encompass a broader range of gender experiences and identities, including those whose gender changes over time, fluctuates in intensity, or exists outside of the male/female binary. It serves the transgender community by promoting inclusivity and understanding.

title: Plume
description: The largest healthcare provider for the trans and nonbinary community offering a range of services including gender-affirming hormone therapy and transition support to medications for anxiety and depression. Services are provided by a trans-led team with a deep understanding of the unique healthcare needs of the community, aimed at making you feel comfortable, seen and cared for. A place where you can be your authentic self and get the care you need.

title: Trans* in 3 Steps
description: A project that serves as a guide to help during the transition of an individual. It includes terminology related to trans*, information on how to know if one is trans*, resources for psychological counseling, medical procedures, anecdotal coming out stories, legal information on changing names and gender status, as well as links to various resources and services.

address: 412 Lygon St, Brunswick East VIC 3057, Australia
title: The Shed Melbourne
description: A Melbourne based support group for transmasculine individuals, offering various events and resources such as peer support meetings, gym clubs, book clubs, mental health resources, surgery and testosterone information and support, binder programmes, and more.

title: Mapping Attacks on LGBTQ Rights in U.S. State Legislatures
description: In the last few years states have advanced a record number of bills that attack LGBTQ rights, especially transgender youth. The ACLU is tracking these attacks and working with our national network of affiliates to support LGBTQ people everywhere. While more states every year work to pass laws to protect LGBTQ people, state legislatures are advancing bills that target transgender people, limit local protections, and allow the use of religion to discriminate. The ACLU will not stop speaking out against these cruel attacks nationwide.

title: National Queer & Trans Therapists of Color Network
description: The National Queer & Trans Therapists of Color Network is a healing justice organization committed to transforming mental health for queer and trans people of color. They work at the intersection of movements for social justice and the field of mental health.

title: SHINE SA
description: A health organization in South Australia that provides clinical services, sexual health counselling and education and training related to sexual and reproductive health and relationship skills. It also gives support and inclusive services for the LGBTIQA+ community. They also participate in celebrating and advocating for international transgender and gender diverse communities rights and recognition.

title: Boston Alliance of LGBTQ+ Youth (BAGLY)
description: BAGLY is a youth-led, adult-supported organization that advocates for programs, policies and services for the LGBTQ+ youth community. It provides an array of resources and programs including healthcare services, food justice, youth leadership development, and more. BAGLY prioritizes the needs of LGBTQ+ youth of color, trans and gender non-conforming youth, and homeless LGBTQ+ youth.

title: Zoe Belle Gender Collective
description: Zoe Belle Gender Collective is a trans and gender diverse led advocacy organisation offering professional training, workshops, and support for the LGBTQI+ community. It provides resources and assistance for community services, workers, families and friends, and trans and gender diverse individuals. It also recently launched Transfemme, a preventative initiative against cis men's violence toward trans women.

title: CenterLink, The Community of LGBTQ Centers
description: CenterLink is an international nonprofit organization and member-based association of LGBTQ centers and other organizations serving their local and regional communities. Their mission is to strengthen, support, and connect LGBTQ community centers, providing essential services, promoting growth, wellness, and connectivity in over 325 LGBTQ communities worldwide.

title: Gender Diversity
description: Gender Diversity improves the well-being of children and adults of all gender identities and expression by providing education, increasing awareness, and offering insight into the wider range of human experience. We also assist in creating supportive and non-discriminatory environments in schools, sports teams, workplaces, and healthcare providers for transgender and gender diverse individuals.

address: 555 W 5th St 35th floor, Los Angeles, CA 90013, USA
title: Equality California
description: Equality California is an organization that brings the voices of LGBTQ+ people and allies to institutions of power in California and across the United States, striving to create a world that is healthy, just, and fully equal for all LGBTQ+ people. They advance civil rights and social justice and work tirelessly on behalf of those they serve. They provide programs, publications, legislations, endorsements and several ways to take action.

address: 152/168 The Horsley Dr, Carramar NSW 2163, Australia
title: NSW Service for the Treatment and Rehabilitation of Torture and Trauma Survivors
description: STARTTS provides culturally relevant psychological treatment, community interventions, and training to services to help people heal from the scars of torture and refugee trauma. They aim to create a safe and supportive environment for diverse sexualities, genders, and bodies including refugees and asylum seekers.

title: Transgender Legal Defense & Education Fund (TLDEF)
description: The TLDEF is committed to ending discrimination based upon gender identity and expression and to achieving equality for transgender people through public education, test-case litigation, direct legal services, and public policy efforts. They provide various services like name change project, impact litigation and trans health project. It also provides updates on related legal matters affecting the transgender community.

title: Trans human rights: ILGA World releases global research into legal gender recognition and criminalisation
description: The third edition of the publication researches provisions which set out how trans and gender-diverse people can change their sex/gender marker and names on official identity documents (legal gender recognition), and also collects information on laws criminalising trans identities, both explicitly and de facto – looking at the situation for our communities in every region of the world.

address: 1122 E Pike St #969, Seattle, WA 98122, USA
title: Gender Justice League
description: Gender Justice League is a civil and human rights organization that focuses on elevating the rights of trans & gender diverse communities in Washington State and beyond. GJL was founded in Seattle, WA in 2012 by a group of long-time trans, queer, and allied activists. They focus on advocacy, providing a safe house program, resources, and special events.

title: National Center for Transgender Equality
description: The National Center for Transgender Equality is an organization advocating to change policies and societal attitudes for increased understanding and acceptance of transgender people. The NCTE provides information about issues affecting the Transgender community including aging, anti-violence, employment, families, health & HIV, housing & homelessness, and more.

title: Transgender Law Center
description: Transgender Law Center is the largest national trans-led organization advocating self-determination for all people. By maintaining robust resources and publications, the Center guides individuals through common legal challenges and questions transgender people encounter. TLC also empowers communities towards a long-term, national, trans-led movement for liberation.

title: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Transidentität und Intersexualität
description: The Deutsche Gesellschaft für Transidentität und Intersexualität (dgti) is a nationwide professional society in Germany that advocates for the acceptance and equality of trans, inter-gender, non-binary, and agender people at all levels of society. The dgti provides peer-to-peer consultation, legal information, news, and has various resource programs for trans* consultants and medical professionals.

address: Lester Rd, Wynberg, Cape Town, 7824, South Africa
county: City of Cape Town Metropolitan Municipality
title: The Inner Circle
description: A Global Muslim community aimed to bring healing to Muslims who are marginalised based on sexual orientation and gender identity through spirituality, education, and movement building

title: Florida Name Change Home
description: This website provides a step-by-step guidance for those who want to update their name or gender in Florida. The steps include filing a petition in court, and updating Social Security card, driver license, passport, and birth certificate.

title: Parents of Gender Diverse Children
description: Parents of Gender Diverse Children provides support, connections, and resources to parents and those parenting transgender and gender diverse children in Australia. The organization offers confidential and non-judgemental peer support, monthly catchups, an online Parent Hub, and professional development and speakers.

title: Amsterdam UMC - Kennis- en Zorgcentrum Genderdysforie
description: The Knowledge and Care Center for Gender Dysphoria at Amsterdam UMC specializes in providing medical treatment and psychological support to people who feel their birth gender does not match their identity. The center embraces individual diversity, tailors its services to personal needs, and is recognized internationally for its expertise in treating gender incongruence. It also undertakes research to improve understanding and treatment of transgender individuals and offers training to new healthcare professionals.

title: Trans Rights Map 2022 reveals slow comeback of progress on trans rights
description: This report by TGEU shows the progress and regression in the legal rights of trans people in Europe and Central Asia. Among other findings, it shows a weakening in areas such as asylum, hate speech, and equality laws, but progress in areas like legal gender recognition and protections against discrimination.

title: Facial Feminization Surgery Procedures
description: 2pass Clinic offers a variety of surgical procedures to help transgender women transition. These include Facial and Body Feminization Surgeries, Permanent Hair Removal and Hair Transplant treatments. This resource provides detailed information on each FFS procedures and helps guide trans women in making the right choices for their journey.

title: Lambert House
description: Lambert House empowers lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth through the development of leadership, social, and life skills. This is a safe space for LGBTQ youth ages 10-22, offering over 30 different annual and ongoing programs, activities, resources, and services. Its supportive environment is suitable for youths to connect and learn from each other.

title: Trans Lifeline
description: Trans Lifeline is a trans-led organization offering peer support and resources for the transgender community. With a focus on community support, microgrants and a hotline, they aim to provide trans people with the connections and resources they need to thrive. Trans Lifeline also advocates for the trans community through initiatives such as #SafeHotlines.

title: Transliving International
description: Transliving International is a global support group for the transgender community providing an online magazine, club nights, events, and shopping platform. It amplifies the voice of all gender diverse and trans-people by offering help, advice, personal stories, and features.

address: 2795 Front St A, Cuyahoga Falls, OH 44221, USA
title: The Azalea Institute: Counseling & Wellness Center
description: The Azalea Institute provides mental health and wellness services with specialties in treating a variety of concerns including complex trauma, PTSD, depression, anxiety, and more. The Institute provides services such as individual, family, and group counseling, as well as training, consultation, and professional development opportunities for clinicians.

title: The Trevor Project
description: The Trevor Project is an American non-profit organization providing suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ youth. The site provides valuable resources for the transgender community, including crisis intervention and suicide prevention lifeline, TrevorChat, and TrevorText as well as guidance on mental health, social services, and support groups.

title: Gender Dysphoria - 1177 Vårdguiden
description: A comprehensive resource on gender dysphoria provided by 1177 healthcare guide in Sweden, discussing what it is, how it feels, how to seek help and various treatments options. It serves by providing detailed information for those experiencing gender dysphoria and supporting them in their journey.

title: Binding 101: Tips to Bind Your Chest Safely
description: A comprehensive guide from Point of Pride, providing tips and resources on safe chest binding. Provides information on styles of binders, rules for safe binding, and resources for acquiring chest binders. Aimed at anyone who desires a flatter chest appearance, with particular focus on trans, non-binary, and genderqueer individuals.

title: Metro Trans Umbrella Group
description: A grassroots nonprofit organization located in Saint Louis, working dedicatedly to create a more inclusive and supportive community for transgender individuals. Provides services like a food pantry, STI Testing, name change assistance, gender affirming clothes and weekly events to empower each other and work towards equality.

title: Pronoun Dressing Room
description: The Pronoun Dressing Room provides an online space where individuals can test out and explore different sets of pronouns to see which ones feel right for them. The website facilitates easier decision making in pronoun selection for the transgender community, allowing them to see how different pronouns might look in different contexts.

title: Queer Sex Ed Podcast
description: A podcast series that aims to ‘queer’ sex ed in order to intentionally include narratives and experiences of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, gender queer, gender fluid, agender people, polyamorous people, asexual people, people with disabilities and more. The show addresses the lack of appropriate sex education and media representation for these communities, and seeks to fight the associated social stigmas.

address: 522 W Maple St, Allentown, PA 18101, USA
title: Bradbury-Sullivan LGBT Community Center
description: Bradbury-Sullivan LGBT Community Center provides a vibrant, inclusive space in Pennsylvania's Lehigh Valley for all of the region's LGBTQ+ residents. It offers community programming, addressing barriers to care through its health programs, organizes annual Pride festival and works towards increasing equity through its LGBTQ+ Education Institute.

title: A Place for Marsha
description: A Place for Marsha is one of many start-up projects aiming towards helping Trans individuals and families in increasingly dangerous states to a safer place. APFM began its journey in March of 2023 in reaction to the rise of anti-trans legislation around the nation. APFM now focuses on matching Refugees from red states as roommates, carefully handling one household at a time.

address: 213 Avenue C S, Saskatoon, SK S7M 1N3, Canada
title: OUTSaskatoon: Support for 2SLGBTQ Community
description: OUTSaskatoon is a community centre and service provider for the Saskatoon and area 2SLGBTQ community. They provide support services, youth housing, and education and research services through a harm reduction, culturally informed, equity-seeking, and community-based approach. They offer counselling and peer support, 2SLGBTQ youth housing (Pride Home), workshops and training, and sexual health clinics.

address: 18 Belmont Rd, Rondebosch, Cape Town, 7700, South Africa
county: City of Cape Town Metropolitan Municipality
title: GOOD HOPE Metropolitan Community Church
description: A theologically progressive and inclusive Christian community founded on the principles of Jesus Christ that celebrates diversity and provides a safe, non-judgmental space where all are welcome. Part of an inclusive Christian congregation based in Cape Town, South Africa and part of the larger international denomination known as Metropolitan Community Churches (MCC).

title: Transfamily
description: A peer support group for parents, siblings, extended family and friends of a trans and gender diverse person. It offers resources, events, and a platform for community stories. It also offers a Transfamily book that provides useful information and insights about the transgender community.

title: University of Toledo Medical Center
description: The University of Toledo Medical Center provides a wide range of medical services and specialties, from emergency medicine to orthopaedics and rehabilitation services. It is committed to offering the highest level of healthcare to the northwest Ohio community. The center offers services like patient information, visitor information, billing and insurance support.

title: TransVoiceLessons
description: TransVoiceLessons offers quality voice control and liberation services for transgender and non-binary individuals aiming to sound more masculine, feminine, or androgynous.

title: Center for Gender Affirming Medicine
description: Akron Children's Hospital offers the Center for Gender Affirming Medicine under its Adolescent Medicine department. It caters to transgender and LGBTQ+ youth, providing a team of specialist physicians, social workers, psychologists, and an endocrinologist. The center offers medical and mental health support to create a gender-diverse environment where youth can explore their gender identity. Services provided include pubertal suppression, gender-affirming hormones, mental health care coordination, well checks/preventive visits and education/supportive care.

title: Working It Out
description: Working It Out is Tasmania's sexuality, gender, and intersex status support and education service. It provides support and advocacy services for LGBTIQ+ Tasmanians and education and training programmes to schools, workplaces, government, and non-government organizations.

title: Thorne Harbour Health
description: A LGBTIQ+ community-controlled organisation providing health and wellbeing services for sex, gender and sexuality diverse communities, including HIV support and prevention, counselling, and family violence services.

title: Queer Lexikon
description: Queer Lexikon is an online resource providing extensive information and support for the queer community. Covering topics varying from sexual, romantic, gender diversity to mental health and support groups. It's a hub for education, awareness, and community stories.

address: 125 Wilson St, Victoria, BC V9A 6X1, Canada

title.en: Transgender Archives at the University of Victoria

description.en: The Transgender Archives at the University of Victoria is committed to preserving the history of pioneering activists, community leaders, and researchers who have contributed to the betterment of Trans+ and other gender-diverse people. The records are accessible to everyone, free of charge.

title: Pride Center San Antonio
description: Pride Center San Antonio serves the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, questioning, and ally community. They host a variety of programs, events, and resources, including support groups, therapy, STI testing, and more. They aim to work in alliance with existing services within the community.

title: Transformering.se
description: A Swedish resource hub run by RFSL Ungdom and RFSL that offers support and information related to transgender and gender identity issues. Contents include rights, relationships, and how gender-affirming care works. It is designed for individuals who are transgender, have personal trans experience, or are questioning their gender identity/expression, as well as their loved ones, professionals, or voluntary workers who support them.

title: TransAmsterdam
description: TransAmsterdam is a trans organization focused on art, culture, and lifestyle in Amsterdam. It supports the transgender community through various pillars. These include creating opportunities to meet via Trans & Friends café, InClusion, and other events. It also promotes talent development through workshops, themed meetings, and theater productions at Trans Art School. Finally, it offers an art and culture platform for and by transgender, non-binary artists, and performers.

title: The Gender Centre Inc.
description: The Gender Centre Inc. is providing a broad range of specialised services that enables the exploration of gender identity and assistance with the alleviation of gender dysphoria. It supports trans and gender expressive people at every stage of their journey as they explore and live their authentic sense of self. It offers accommodation, case management, education & training, counseling & mental health services, groups, news, and resources.

title: Learning With Love: The 2023 PFLAG National Convention
description: A four-day event organized by PFLAG for connecting, networking, learning, and sharing experiences. The convention will host workshops, panels, and presentations to support their mission of creating a caring, just, and affirming world for LGBTQ+ people and those who love them.

title: Freedom Centre
description: Freedom Centre provides a broad range of support services for LGBTIQA+ young people around WA, including drop-in sessions, community development, counselling and much more. They work towards making all LGBTIQA+ young people feel included, connected and respected. They also provide training and guidance to parents, professionals, communities and organisations.

title: Trans Fertility Co. Shop Live
description: Trans Fertility Co. Shop is providing resources, interviews and personal stories regarding diverse aspects of transgender fertility. It is a platform to learn, share and celebrate the trans fertility.

title: Point of Pride
description: Point of Pride provides financial aid and direct support to trans folks who are in need of health and wellness care. The aid programs range from annual transgender surgery funds, HRT Access funds, electrolysis support and free chest binders and femme shapewear provision to trans people who can't afford or find them safely.

title: TransMann e.V.
description: TransMann e.V. is a voluntary, non-profit organization that provides wide-range support for all Female-to-Male (FzM/FtM) Trans* and Inter*-people across Germany. The services include group meetings, online information and resources, Peer-to-Peer counseling, educational materials and public appearances. They also maintain a nationwide database of Trans*-experienced doctors and therapists. Though their primary audience is FzM-Trans* and Inter* people, they also extend their resources and support to family members, friends, partners, educational institutions, and employers.

title: RainbowRailroad.org
description: A vital online platform dedicated to assisting and advocating for LGBTQ+ individuals who are facing persecution and violence worldwide. With unwavering commitment, the website connects those in immediate danger to life-saving resources, emergency assistance, and secure pathways to safety. Through partnerships with local organizations and a network of compassionate supporters, RainbowRailroad.org works tirelessly to provide advocacy, legal aid, and relocation support, enabling individuals to escape persecution and find refuge. By championing human rights, saving lives, and fostering a more inclusive world, RainbowRailroad.org serves as a beacon of hope and protection for LGBTQ+ individuals seeking safety and freedom.

title: BlaQ Aboriginal Corporation
description: BlaQ Aboriginal Corporation is a community organisation dedicated to supporting and empowering the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander LGBTQ+SB community through innovation, inclusion, understanding and advocacy.

title: Refuge Restrooms
description: Refuge Restrooms is a web application that seeks to provide safe restroom access for transgender, intersex, and gender nonconforming individuals. Users can search for restrooms by proximity to a search location, add new restroom listings, as well as comment and rate existing listings.

title: Baby Making for Everybody
description: A how-to guide and celebration of various family creation methods outside of the traditional heterosexual-nuclear-family model for LGBTQ+ and solo parents. The book provides a step-by-step guide alongside personal narratives, providing prospective parents a blueprint to grow their families.

address: 8390 W Flagler St STE 201, Miami, FL 33144, USA
title: The McKenzie Project
description: A comprehensive resource offering services, programs and events aimed at promoting gender justice and serving the transgender community. Includes support services and resources including healthcare, legal assistance, mental health services and more.

title: East Bay Trans & Queer Counseling
description: East Bay Trans & Queer Counseling offers sliding scale services that include: Individual Therapy centrally located in Berkeley, CA Support through gender exploration and transition Recommendation letters for hormones and surgery Professional trainings for mental health providers, students, and employers. Sam Davis is a transgender, genderqueer Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) specializing in working with trans, queer, genderqueer, and gender-nonconforming teens and adults. They have 16 years of experience as a mental health provider in the East Bay, including peer support group facilitation, community education at LGBTQI conferences, and 9 years of clinical practice and crisis counseling with severely marginalized people for the County of Alameda. They are a strong and committed advocate with a long history of organizing on behalf of marginalized people.

title: LGBTQ+ Health Services by CDPH
description: The California Department of Public Health (CDPH) caters to the health of all Californians including the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) communities. They provide resources to understand health issues that most often impact the LGBT community, necessary screenings at various life stages, and tools for a healthy lifestyle.

address: 112 State Ave NE, Olympia, WA 98501, USA
title: Stonewall Youth
description: Stonewall Youth is a nonprofit organization that offers support for LGBTQ+ youth. Their comprehensive weekly programs, support groups, and resources cater to the needs of queer and trans youth. They provide food, essential items, and even sponsorship for youth fellowships. Stonewall Youth is dedicated to creating an empowering space for LGBTQ+ youth to lead, learn, and share their experiences.

title: Seahorse Victoria Club
description: Est. 1975, Seahorse Club Victoria provides resources, community service and support for the transgender community. It includes a trans-friendly directory of services and an upcoming online platform for members to connect.

address: 475 Park Ave S #2100, New York, NY 10016, USA
title: Family Equality
description: Family Equality is a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting and supporting LGBTQ+ families. They fight for legal protections, provide resources and education, and actively advocate for LGBTQ+ rights. This organization hosts various events and helps connect families to each other and the broader LGBTQ+ community.

address: 3656 N Halsted St, Chicago, IL 60613, USA
title: Center on Halsted
description: Chicago's community center dedicated to advancing the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender (LGBT) and Queer (+) community through providing service programs, events, trainings, and resources. Including services for HIV/AIDS & STD, Behavioral Health, Anti-violence and special programs for the youth and seniors.

title: Voice Resource Repository
description: The Voice Resource Repository is an open and evolving project started by Sumi and Emma aiming to provide approachable information and direction for those wishing to change their voice. Focused on both feminisation and masculinisation practices, this initiative is meant to assist beginners and serve as a comprehensive reference for students and teachers alike. Though still mostly feminisation oriented, work is being carried out to make it agnostic to users' goals.

title: A Complete Guide to Transmasculine Reproduction
description: A comprehensive guide offering information on transmasculine fertility, pregnancy, postpartum, lactation, and parenthood. The resource includes trans-affirming health care providers, researched FAQs, various resources and more for educating and supporting transmasculine individuals on their parenting journey.

title: TRANSGENDER MICHIGAN
description: Transgender Michigan’s primary mission is to provide advocacy, support and education while serving to create coalitions in the state of Michigan to unify and empower transgender and gender non-conformist communities.

title: Equality Florida
description: Florida's largest LGBTQ advocacy organization working towards safe and healthy schools, LGBTQ health equity, HIV advocacy, LGBTQ protections and more. The organization holds various events and has secured pro-equality supports, contributing towards transgender health care grants.

title: TransHub
description: TransHub is a digital information and resource platform for all trans and gender diverse people in NSW, their loved ones, allies and health providers. It provides access to much needed information and resources for a community that may not have had access to such as they grew up or grew towards their authentic selves. Information ranges from medical needs such as hormones, surgeries and doctor lists to social and legal issues.

title: Twenty10
description: Twenty10 including GLCS provides various life-changing services to young people across NSW who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender or gender diverse, intersex, queer, asexual or are questioning their identity. Their services include intake and referral, housing and case management, counseling, social support programs, and LGBTIQA+ inclusivity training

title: Rainbow Center
description: Rainbow Center aims to boost the resources and safety of the LGBTQ2SA community through education, advocacy, and celebration. It also acknowledges the events taking place on Coast Salish land and the cultural significance and history it holds.

title: Transgender Map
description: Transgendermap.com is an online resource aimed at providing practical information and guidance to people who are questioning their gender identity or are somewhere on the transgender spectrum. The website includes a wide range of topics like understanding transgender terminology, transition processes, legal issues, healthcare, and numerous personal stories. Its goal is to help individuals navigate their personal journeys by providing a 'map' or guide to the many aspects of gender identity and transgender experiences. Please visit the actual site for the most current and accurate information.

title: Transgender Health Program at Massachusetts General Hospital
description: The Transgender Health Program at Massachusetts General Hospital provides personalized, up to date and high quality medical care for transgender individuals, youth, and caregivers. The program offers various resources, answers to frequently asked questions, and a specialized care team.

title: The GenderAid
description: The GenderAid is a decision aid for genital gender surgery, aiming to provide complete and reliable information about the treatment options. It focuses on the Dutch health care system, adhering to the guidelines of the WPATH, and has been developed for all parts of the transgender community, including non-binary, genderfluid, and genderqueer individuals.

title: TransFolk of WA
description: A peer support service for transgender people and their loved ones in Western Australia. Offering online groups, recommended services and resources, and hosting various events.

title: Transcend Australia
description: Transcend Australia’s purpose is to support, affirm and celebrate the lives of trans and gender diverse children and their families and carers. They provide information, support and referrals to families across Australia and work to empower trans and gender diverse children and young people.

title: Acoustic Gender
description: An online platform that provides an interactive visual aid for understanding how voices are perceived in terms of gender. It plots recordings of the user's voice to enable the visualization of pitch and resonance over time which can inform their voice transition journey if needed.

title: Planned Parenthood
description: Planned Parenthood provides vital reproductive health care, sex education, and information to millions of people worldwide. Services include abortion, birth control, STD testing and treatment, transgender hormone therapy, and more. Online and telehealth appointments available.

title: Camp Lilac
description: Camp Lilac is a summer camp in Ohio providing a safe, welcoming, and confidential space for transgender and gender diverse youth. The camp provides an environment where gender diversity is the norm and the program is designed to instill confidence in the campers as well as provide a strong community of peers and supporters.

title: RFSL - The Swedish Federation for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer Rights
description: RFSL is a Swedish organization that works with and for LGBTQ rights. They provide crucial resources, community support, education & awareness, legal guidance, health services, and more for the transgender community. RFSL also promotes LGBTQ rights on an international level.

address: 615 W Wellington Ave, Chicago, IL 60657, USA
title: Transgender Youth Resource and Advocacy (TYRA) Group
description: TYRA is a support group for transgender and questioning youth, 24 and under, to meet people, get informed, and be supported by their peers. The session happens every Thursday from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm.

description.en-US: A blog post discussing the concept of the default assumption of cisgender identity often held in society, and arguing for a more balanced approach to questioning and confirming one's gender identity.

title: Apotheek.nl - All about Medication
description: A resource offering reliable information about various medications. The site includes videos, current affairs in health, information on vaccination, coronavirus, and pharmacy care. It provides information in Dutch and translates 50 key medications for Ukrainian refugees.

title: Transgender Equality ID Documents Center
description: A comprehensive resource that helps individuals to update their name and gender on state and federal IDs and records. It provides information on policy grades for each state and steps for various processes including updating passports, social security records, military/veteran records, etc.

title: TransHealthCare
description: TransHealthCare is the largest and most comprehensive database of Gender Surgeons. It has helped thousands of transgender and non-binary people from around the world find a surgeon. The website provides a platform to find a surgeon based on procedure, U.S. State, insurance type, and country. It also hosts a variety of resources including latest surgeon news and research on gender-affirming surgery.

title: GenderGP: Comprehensive Support for Transgender Individuals
description: GenderGP offers a comprehensive suite of services encompassing advocacy, advice, healthcare, and a range of complementary services for trans people globally. The platform provides an avenue for transgender individuals to access gender-affirming healthcare, legal transition assistances, and social transition supports. Through its globally accessible digital platform, GenderGP is committed to enabling trans people to live their lives more comfortably and authentically.

title: Trans Families
description: Trans Families inspires hope, increases understanding, and creates a visible pathway to support trans and gender diverse children and all those who touch their lives. We provide resources, organize events, and connect families to support groups.

title: Guide to Being an Ally to Transgender and Nonbinary Young People
description: An introductory educational resource that provides comprehensive information and best practices on how to support transgender and nonbinary young people. The guide is instrumental in beginning your education on the basics of gender identity and expression.
